page.title: 02DESCRIPTION OF AREA CONTD.
page.content: The Dorran Tarran houses, two dwellings per block, were erected in 1949 by the County Council for agricultural workers and have recently been modernised and brought up to standard. Through this building in 1949 mains water and drainage were brought to the area. The only street lighting in the whole of the area is in Imrie Crescent where the above houses are situated.The two roads in this area are unlit and, as there are no pavements along the road sides walking can be hazardous, especially in the dark evenings and with the ever increasing amount of traffic. Also in this area are a church, an hotel and historic monuments. {
